metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3421 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the RPM package in the read functionality. This flaw allows an attacker who can convince a victim to install a seemingly verifiable package or compromise an RPM repository, to cause RPM database corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity. This flaw affects RPM versions before 4.17.0-alpha.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

debugedit - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpm3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmbuild3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmio3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmsign3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-rpm - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-rpm - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm-common - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm-i18n - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm2cpio - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Only debugedit and librpmio9 binary packages are in main, and triaged with view to how they are used in the build process as described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rpm/+bug/1913871

criterions.comment: rpm package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
